description.overall: The function 'show_page' displays key performance indicators (KPIs) and visualizes data quality metrics using Streamlit components. It calculates and presents various statistics such as row counts, null value ratios, and unique ID checks for two datasets. Additionally, it generates two charts: one showing the top columns with the highest null value ratios and another displaying error frequency by weekday and hour. The function relies on precomputed metrics stored in dictionaries and DataFrames.

description.overall: This function takes a pandas DataFrame as input and groups the data by the 'KvaRechnung_ID' column to count the number of associated 'Position_ID' entries for each unique identifier. It then returns a new DataFrame containing the 'KvaRechnung_ID' and the corresponding count of positions, renamed to 'PositionsAnzahl'. The function leverages pandas groupby and count operations to perform the aggregation.

description.overall: This function evaluates a DataFrame containing 'Auftragsdaten' data to identify instances where, if at least two values among the three columns Forderung_Netto, Empfehlung_Netto, and Einigung_Netto are negative, the third value should also be negative. It counts and returns the number of violations of this rule. The function uses boolean masking to determine which rows fail the condition.

parameters.description: DataFrame with 'Auftragsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: error_count
returns.description: Number of entries in any of the three columns Forderung, Empfehlung or Einigung failing the check.

description.overall: The function evaluates a 'Positionsdaten' dataset contained in a pandas DataFrame for entries in specific columns that fall outside of a reasonable value range. It checks for negative values in several monetary and quantity-related columns, considering their relationships with corresponding 'Einigung' columns. The function aggregates the count of such invalid entries across all relevant columns and returns the total error count. This serves as a quality control measure to identify potential data inconsistencies or anomalies.

description.overall: This function filters a pandas DataFrame to identify rows where the 'Einigung_Netto' column has values greater than or equal to 50000. It is designed to flag potentially suspicious financial entries that may require manual review. The function takes a DataFrame as input and returns a new DataFrame containing only the rows that meet the specified condition. The filtering operation uses boolean indexing to select matching records. No additional processing or transformations are applied to the data beyond the filtering step.

description.overall: This function identifies outliers in a specified numerical column of a pandas DataFrame based on a given quantile range, considering different damage types. It calculates symmetric upper and lower bounds for each group of damage types and filters the DataFrame to return rows that fall outside these bounds. The function allows filtering by a specific damage type and supports custom column selection for outlier detection.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame to be evaluated

parameters.name: schadenart
parameters.description: specific damage type label to filter for, by default None

parameters.name: set_quantile
parameters.description: desired quantile range, symmetric upper/lower bound is inferred, by default 0.99

parameters.name: column_choice
parameters.description: numeric column containing outliers, by default 'Forderung_Netto'

returns.name: df_outlier
returns.description: df containing all suspicious rows

description.overall: The function 'check_zeitwert' evaluates whether the values in the column 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto' satisfy a specific condition related to 'Zeitwert = Forderung-Einigung'. It computes the relative error by comparing the difference between 'Forderung_Netto' and 'Einigung_Netto' with the 'Differenz_vor_Zeitwert_Netto'. This function is intended for use with 'Auftragsdaten' datasets. The result is a pandas Series containing only the non-zero error values.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: DataFrame containing 'Auftragsdaten' data set that is to be evaluated.

returns.name: zeitwert_error
returns.description: Series of all error values (float) found in the data frame

description.overall: The function calculates the average number of positions per order for each month. It takes two DataFrames, one containing order information and another with position details, and merges them based on a shared identifier. The function aggregates the data by month to compute metrics such as average positions per order, total positions, and the count of orders. It also computes the percentage growth rate of the average positions per order over time.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten mit Spalte 'KvaRechnung_ID' und einer Zeitspalte.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Positionsdaten mit Spalten 'KvaRechnung_ID' und 'Position_ID'.

parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in orders_df (z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit').

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'Zeitperiode', 'Avg_Positionen_pro_Auftrag', 'Total_Positionen', 'Anzahl_Auftraege', 'Growth_rate_%'

description.overall: Die Funktion aggregiert die Fehlerhäufigkeit (NaN-Werte) in einem DataFrame nach Wochentag und Stunde. Ein Auftrag gilt als fehlerhaft, wenn in mindestens einer der relevanten Spalten ein NaN-Wert vorhanden ist. Sie wandelt die Zeitspalte in ein Datetime-Format um, extrahiert Wochentag und Stunde, bestimmt relevante Spalten für die Prüfung auf NaN-Werte und berechnet anschließend die Fehlerquote pro Zeit-Slot. Das Ergebnis ist ein DataFrame mit den Spalten 'weekday', 'hour', 'total_rows', 'error_rows' und 'error_rate'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Auftragsdaten-DataFrame (z.B. Auftragsdaten_konvertiert), muss 'KvaRechnung_ID' und die Zeitspalte enthalten.

parameters.name: time_col
parameters.description: Name der Zeitspalte in df, z.B. 'CRMEingangszeit'.

parameters.name: relevant_columns
parameters.description: Liste der Spalten, die auf NaN geprüft werden sollen. Wenn None -> alle Spalten außer 'KvaRechnung_ID' und time_col.

returns.name: result
returns.description: DataFrame mit Spalten: 'weekday' (Name des Wochentags), 'hour' (Stunde von 0 bis 23), 'total_rows' (Anzahl Aufträge in diesem Zeit-Slot), 'error_rows' (Anzahl fehlerhafter Aufträge in diesem Slot), 'error_rate' (Fehlerquote in Prozent).

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: The function 'get_mismatched_entries' computes similarity scores between pairs of 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' entries in a DataFrame using sentence embeddings. It leverages a pre-trained multilingual model to encode the text data, calculates cosine distances between corresponding embeddings, and identifies mismatched entries based on a configurable similarity threshold. The resulting DataFrame contains only those rows where the similarity score falls below the threshold, sorted in ascending order of similarity.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing columns 'Gewerk_Name' and 'Handwerker_Name' to compare.

parameters.name: threshold
parameters.description: A float value representing the minimum similarity score threshold for considering an entry a mismatch. Default is 0.2.

returns.name: mismatches
returns.description: A filtered and sorted copy of the input DataFrame containing only rows where the similarity score is less than the specified threshold.

usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: This function processes a DataFrame to identify outliers in the relationship between craftsmen and their trades. It calculates the ratio of each trade per craftsman and flags those trades as outliers if the craftsman has more than one trade and the trade represents less than 20% of their total trades. The function filters out missing values and returns a DataFrame with the results.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: Input DataFrame containing columns 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: stats
returns.description: A DataFrame containing information about craftsmen, their trades, counts, ratios, and outlier status.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.

description.overall: This function analyzes a DataFrame to determine if the 'Handwerker_Name' column contains keywords associated with specific trades ('Gewerk_Name'). It uses a predefined mapping of keywords for each trade to identify potential matches. If a keyword is found in the name and corresponds to the expected trade, it marks the entry as 'CONFIRMED_BY_NAME'. If a keyword is found but doesn't match the expected trade, it flags a conflict with the corresponding trade. Otherwise, it returns 'NO_KEYWORD_INFO'.

parameters.name: df
parameters.description: A pandas DataFrame containing at least two columns: 'Handwerker_Name' and 'Gewerk_Name'.

returns.name: final_result
returns.description: An array or Series of strings indicating the result for each row: 'CONFIRMED_BY_NAME', 'CONFLICT_WITH_<TRADE>', or 'NO_KEYWORD_INFO'.

description.overall: Die Funktion 'abgleich_auftraege' vergleicht die Kopfdaten von Aufträgen (df1) mit der Summe ihrer Positionen (df2). Sie gruppiert die Positionsdaten nach 'Kva_RechnungID', bildet die Summen für 'Forderung_Netto' und 'Einigung_Netto', und vergleicht diese mit den Werten in df1. Dabei werden Gleitkomma-Ungenauigkeiten berücksichtigt. Die Funktion gibt einen DataFrame mit den IDs und Differenzen zurück, bei denen die Werte nicht übereinstimmen.

parameters.name: df1
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Auftragsdaten (Soll-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

parameters.name: df2
parameters.description: Dataframe mit den Positionsdaten (Ist-Werte). Muss folgende Spalten enthalten: 'Kva_RechnungID', 'Forderung_Netto', 'Einigung_Netto'.

returns.name: result_df
returns.description: Ein DataFrame mit den IDs und Differenzen, bei denen die Werte nicht übereinstimmen. Enthält die Spalten 'KvaRechnung_ID', 'Diff_Forderung', 'Diff_Einigung'.

usage_context.calls: This function calls no other functions.
usage_context.called_by: This function is not called by any other functions.
